result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald A Wesley Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, domestic abuse assessments during the period  of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Obtain full time/part time employment and or schooling.

No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
No use of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with the victim Yakema M. without approval of the Court.
Court will allow for 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with his child as approved by the agent.

Cooperate with agent.
Attend Parenting Classes.
Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by the agent.
Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program (BIP).

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED pending a Probation Review Hearing on 09-25-2015 at 01:30 in Branch 40.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, domestic abuse assessments during the period  of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald A Wesley Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.  RMM

Defendant Ronald A Wesley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement made as to Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served. 

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 Months with the following conditions as to probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, domestic abuse assessments during the period  of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Obtain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Attend Parenting Classes.
*  Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by the agent.
*  No use of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
*  No contact with the victim Yakema M. without approval of the Court.
* Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program (BIP).
* Court will allow for 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with his child as approved by the agent.

AS TO COUNT 4:    COURT ORDERED  Defendant to serve 7 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 7 days TIME SERVED. 

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 30 DAYS condition time at the House of Correction (HOC) IMPOSED AND STAYED pending a Probation Review Hearing on 09-25-2015 at 01:30 in Branch 40.

Received and filed with court:
*  Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Ronald A Wesley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Due to court calendar congestion, matter is adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 1 and 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. As to Count 2 as amended and Count 4:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect. Court vacated Jury Trial date of 06/08/2015. Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Ronald A Wesley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. As to Count 2: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 940.19(1) and 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald A Wesley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald A Wesley in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion For Reduction of Bail

Defendant Ronald A Wesley in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for preliminary hearing.  Defendant was sent to the public defender's office and is eligible.  Court found cause and ordered matter adjourned so counsel can be appointed.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Yakema M.

Defendant Ronald A Wesley in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Ronald A Wesley in custody.  Karen A. Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to counts 3 and 4.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
